motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • Approval of April 10, 2023, City Council Meeting Minutes • Approval of Contract with DeKalb Community Service Board to Provide a Licensed Behavioral Health Clinician to DPD • Resolution Appointing a Member to Serve on the Audit Committee • Resolution Appointing Members to Serve on the Sustainability Committee • Funding Authorization for 2428 Sandell Drive Storm Repairs

motions.title: Motion to Enter Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to enter executive session for litigation and real estate discussion.

motions.title: Motion to Adjourn from Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to adjourn from executive session for real estate discussion.

specialEvents.title: Sustainability Hero Awards
specialEvents.description: Recognition of Michael Cowan as individual Sustainability Hero and Blooms of Dunwoody as business recipient of Sustainability Hero program.

specialEvents.title: Audit Committee Appointment Recognition
specialEvents.description: Recognition of LaRee Holloway as new member of Audit Committee, and Gayatri Chamdra and Larry Heiman as new members of Sustainability Committee.

presentations.title: 2023 Community Survey Results
presentations.description: Presentation of 2023 Community Survey results with 525 participants showing 96% satisfaction with quality of life and 86% satisfaction with city services.
presentations.presenter: J. Jay Vinicki and Adam Probolsky (Probolsky Research, remote)

presentations.title: Sustainability Committee Annual Update
presentations.description: Annual update from Sustainability Committee highlighting 2022 household hazardous waste events and 2023 priorities, requesting two events in 2024 budget.

presentations.title: Draft Dunwoody Trail Master Plan
presentations.description: Presentation of draft Trail Master Plan including Phase 1 Implementation (North Nancy Creek Greenway 1.5 miles, $10.9M), Phase 2 (6.8 miles, $39.3M), and full build-out (68.7 miles total).
presentations.presenter: Greta DeMayo and Eric Ganther (PATH Foundation) with Richard McLeod

discussionItems.title: Renewal of Property & Liability Insurance with GIRMA
discussionItems.description: Presentation of property and liability insurance renewal for May 1, 2023-April 30, 2024 period in amount of $632,374 (increase of $61,089 from 2022).

discussionItems.title: North Shallowford Road Properties Budget Allocation
discussionItems.description: Presentation of budget allocation: $1.0M for Peachtree Middle School turf, $1.5M for Brook Run Maintenance Facility, $3.0M for future capital maintenance over five years, $1.8M unallocated capital.

discussionItems.title: Park Naming Campaign for Vermack Road and Roberts Drive Properties
discussionItems.description: Presentation of park naming campaign for Vermack Road and Roberts Drive park properties with eight submitted names for consideration.
discussionItems.presenter: Brent Walker and Council Member Lautenbacher

notes: Extensive public comments on trail master plan with both support and opposition
Council Member Heneghan read prepared statement detailing concerns with trail master plan
Council Member Lambert suggested removing Brook Farm spur and portions through City of Doraville
Mayor Deutsch suggested focusing first project on Dunwoody Village or Perimeter Center instead of North Nancy Creek
Multiple neighborhoods represented in opposition including Brook Farm, Redfield, and areas along North Peachtree Road
